definition: alveolar/consonants z, c, s produced with the tip of the tongue on the alveolar ridge
retroflex sound (e.g. in Mandarin zh, ch, sh, r)
apical consonant (produced with the tip of the tongue, i.e. d or t)

sentences.english: You know, stuff like ‘the tip of the tongue, the teeth, the lips’ repeated over-and-over.
sentences.chinese: 你知道“舌尖，牙齒，嘴脣”等在不停的重複運動。

sentences.english: The apex of the flames licked the crimson sky.
sentences.chinese: 火焰的舌尖舔卷着緋紅色的天空。

sentences.english: With dizziness insomnia, five frustrating heat, night sweat, apical dishes, pulse counting.
sentences.chinese: 伴頭暈失眠，五心煩熱，盜汗，舌尖暗紅。

sentences.english: The word was on the tip of Jo's tongue to ask, but she checked herself in time.
sentences.chinese: 這句話已經衝到裘的舌尖，可她還是及時剎住了。

sentences.english: Is again numb and weak to obtain overseas from her peak of the tongue, collapse tight body nerveless soft come down.
sentences.chinese: 陣陣酥麻從她舌尖傳開，崩緊的身體無力的軟了下來。

sentences.english: The lips are posed in simple curves, and note the drag on the tip of the tongue.
sentences.chinese: 眼皮呈單純曲線狀，同時注意到舌尖往上拉的狀態。

sentences.english: You may wish to use the tip of your tongue.
sentences.chinese: 你可能會想用上你的舌尖。

sentences.english: Then try the "pointy-tongue" technique to stroke up and down and side to side.
sentences.chinese: 然後試着使用“舌尖”技巧來上下左右舔舐。

sentences.english: Aahh-iihh. In the ah vowel, the tongue is very relaxed, so the front is just kind of sitting there.
sentences.chinese: 時舌頭非常放鬆，舌尖基本就是躺在那裏。

sentences.english: Smoked salmon on our salad brings you smoking good flavor.
sentences.chinese: 薰鮭魚沙拉與衆不同進口薰鮭魚優遊舌尖新滋味。

sentences.english: Those words and structures have to make it to the tip of your tongue within a split second.
sentences.chinese: 這些詞彙和語法結構必須在一瞬間從你的舌尖迸出。

sentences.english: Such a quill, comes from nowhere, dancing on the tip-top of your lovely tongue.
sentences.chinese: 這管可愛的鵝毛筆，來無蹤影，在你的舌尖跳着舞蹈。

sentences.english: Their tongues were draped with beautiful words, but behind that they were spitting out poison.
sentences.chinese: 舌尖編織着優美的言辭，背後卻吐出致命的毒藥。

sentences.english: But it's sweet. One must melt it with the heat of the tongue, then tase its sweetness.
sentences.chinese: 這種甜蜜時要親身用舌尖的熱量才能融化，才能品嚐。

definition: lit. lips and teeth (idiom); fig. close partners/interdependent
tongue/CL:個|个[ge4]/enemy soldier captured for the purpose of extracting information
readily/flatly (deny, admit and so on)/a mouthful/a bite
